Topic.Title: AAPL: you will implode w/o INTC

Message.Msg: Intel likely will acquire SIMG; Silicon Image SIMG reports on Tuesday; check out the SIMG message board! Silicon Image, Inc. has a 5-Year Projected Earnings Per Share Growth Rate of 40.00%, a Current Ratio of 3.85, and a Quick Ratio of 3.63. The short interest was 4.30% as of July 27, 2012. Silicon Image, Inc. provides wireless and wired connectivity solutions that enable the distribution and presentation of high-definition (HD) content for mobile, consumer electronics (CE), and personal computer (PC) markets. The company delivers its technology via semiconductor and intellectual property products and services. It offers high-definition multimedia interface (HDMI) and mobile high-definition link (MHL) transmitters for mobile devices, such as smartphones and tablets; and MHL-to-HDMI bridges for docking stations and adapters connecting MHL mobile products with HDMI-enabled digital televisions (DTVs) and displays. http://seekingalpha.com/article/759561-4-fast-growing-small-cap-stocks-with-flush-reserves?source=yahoo

Message.Title: Friday Aug 3rd Ex-dividend
Message.Msg: Let the options games begin. Intel should trade plus/minus the dividend amount around the strike prices. The option arbitraging should provide some gravity toward those price points since the option premium is highest. Today, SOXX and the semis are down 1.5%+ while Intel is trading down 1%. Watch for unusual option volume and for this pattern to influence trading till Friday AM. Thursday after the close, there will be a 22.5 cent discontinuity in the pricing of Intel stock. The ADJUSTED price of Intel will be adjusted down 22.5 cents to reflect the value of the dividend awarded to shareholders. Put options will increase in value by 22.5 cents. Call options will drop in value by 22.5 cents. Watch for unusual option volumes and expect that some call options will be exercised on Thursday as the premium drops to zero in the afternoon. The option market maker has lots of fun during these situations. "payable on September 1, 2012, to stockholders of record on August 7, 2012, with an ex-dividend date of August 3, 2012." Intel (INTC) Declares $0.225 Quarterly Dividend; 3.6% Yield http://www.streetinsider.com/Dividends/Intel+(INTC)+Declares+$0.225+Quarterly+Dividend%3B+3.6%25+Yield/7606570.html

Message.Title: The olympics? Just enjoy and laugh.
Message.Msg: Me--I will be watcing baseball. In fact, I would rather watch almost any major sport other than the Olympics. Football NFL Baseball MLB Basketball NBA Even a good pro soccer match is better. Let the weird sports have their every 4 years and then we can ignore them for 4 more. I mean if most of us or a major group of us loved these sports so much, the ones in the Olympics, we would see them constantly on TV. Just like Turkey--we love it now and then but not often. Me? The political BS and the waving of the flags is too much BS for me to take so I likely will not watch any of it. It is 90% hype and BS!

Topic.Title: The olympics? Just enjoy and laugh.

Message.Msg: Oh yeah--if we had a real National contest it would have events like this. Happiest people by nation. We would not win. Lowest crime rate--No medal for US their. Cleanest water and air Nicest people Best medical care Best schools Just think a moment. A good surgeon can save a few lives a week. Maybe a dozen or more in a city like Chicago can be saved by a trauma team. Gold medal each day for them. How about the teacher who taught your kids to read? Gold medal for them too. The one that taught you and I? Two gold medals. The policemen who show up when they know a nut with a gun is on the lose. Gold Gold Gold. The Firemen and women who climb into a burning building looking for people. There is nothing so brave. Then we have our fighting men and women in the service fighting for our nation. They did not pick the war and likely think the wars are stupid but they love their nation and they do their jobs. They are the heroes and to hellll with all the hype about winning a footrace. it is fun and I am glad for the kids participating but it is all just a game. Those kids in Afghanistan are playing NO game.

Message.Title: Haswell - First 22nm SoC for the PC, 20 times less power than Ivy Bridge
Message.Msg: The processor will mark another jump in speed for Intel, but also bring with it reduced power requirements. Intel is pitching the 22nm processor as the first System on a Chip for the PC, claiming that it will use up to 20 times less power than Ivy Bridge. That low-power requirement will be especially important for ultrabooks, enabling true all day computing and bringing them closer to ARM-based tablets. http://www.slashgear.com/intel-699-ultrabooks-coming-soon-30240864/

Message.Title: The Coming Battle for AMD's x86 Hidden Cache Edit
Message.Msg: Written by Ed McKernan: http://www.semiwiki.com/forum/content/1533-coming-battle-amd-x86-hidden-cache.html

Topic.Title: Haswell - First 22nm SoC for the PC, 20 times less power than Ivy Bridge

Message.Msg: "Intel is pitching the 22nm processor as the first System on a Chip" strange pitch... considering it's a MCM and NOT an SOC...
Great return

Topic.Title: Haswell - First 22nm SoC for the PC, 20 times less power than Ivy Bridge

Message.Msg: btw, since it's an MCM, and NOT an SOC... will it still require a fan ???

Topic.Title: Haswell - First 22nm SoC for the PC, 20 times less power than Ivy Bridge

Message.Msg: If we want to nitpick, we can call it MCM at 22nm and SoC at 14nm (because it is likely to be one circuit at 14nm) Either way, Haswell will consume 5% of the power of Ivy Bridge - which will be 0.75-3W for most of its chips. I think most devices running Haswell will not need a fan, chip experts can confirm.

Message.Title: Just A Thought
Message.Msg: Expectations are high for the central bankers to act this week. This could potentially set the market up for disappointment. With stocks now in overbought territory and negative divergences persisting on the charts of the major indexes, it would be a good idea to take some positions off the table or hedge some positions. The sideways market we've been in since mid May looks to continue for a while. Notable earnings due out on Tuesday include: PFE, CNW, AET, ALL, BP, VLO, X and TYC. Have a nice evening
http://finance.yahoo.com/q/bc?t=5y&s=CRUS&l=on&z=l&q=l&c=aapl&ql=1 and then there's the laggard, INTC, bogged down by the dying pc market

Message.Title: Arm vs Intel
Message.Msg: http://techland.time.com/2012/07/16/arm-vs-intel-how-the-processor-wars-will-benefit-consumers-most/

"Windows for ARM gave Microsoft an opportunity to do a new version of Windows without all of the backward compatibility requirements, so the code is streamlined. And we’re hearing from early tests that it runs Windows RT apps as much as 20% faster than apps running on Intel chips. Also, Microsoft is including a full version of Office on all Windows RT-based devices, so they come with a good set of productivity apps from the start." ...from the start "For 30 years, Intel basically had the market to itself and as a result, its chips were priced much higher than ARM chips. But ARM’s entry into Intel’s territory is a real threat to Intel’s dominance. First time in decades INtel has had competition !!!! "huge win for consumers" !!!!!
